Something was wrong with the French Army in 1940

Germany emerged victorious from the XIth Olympiad. German athletes captured the most medals, and German hospitality and organization won the praises of many visitors. Most newspaper accounts echoed the New York Times report

In 1936, after several years of negotiations and efforts to achieve a higher level of self-government, and with the pressure originated with the Italian invasion of Ethiopia, the United Kingdom finally agreed to sign a Anglo-Egyptian Treaty. Although the treaty did not include dismantling of British garrisons, and did not reduce British meddling in Egyptian affairs, it was a decisive step forward. The treaty guaranteed that the United Kingdom would always respect Egyptian independence and self-government, and would protect Egypt from any outside aggression.

In 1936, after several years of negotiations and efforts to achieve a higher level of self-government, and with the pressure originated with the Italian invasion of Ethiopia, the United Kingdom finally agreed to sign a Anglo-Egyptian Treaty. Although the treaty did not include dismantling of British garrisons, and did not reduce British meddling in Egyptian affairs, it was a decisive step forward. The treaty guaranteed that the United Kingdom would always respect Egyptian independence and self-government, and would protect Egypt from any outside aggression.
The growing conflict between the Iraqi nationalists and Britain would lead the Axis to request use of Syrian facilities to transport supplies to the Iraqi government

When neutral Iraq refused to allow the British use of the Habaniyya Air Base near Baghdad in spite of the 1930 Treaty, the British decided to force the issue by demanding a pro-British government in Iraq
Having driven the Gaullists out of Lebanon, Syria reaffirmed its loyalty to Vichy
Having driven the Gaullists out of Lebanon, Syria installs a pro-Vichy government in Beirut
Having driven the Gaullists out of Lebanon, Syria installs a pro-Vichy government in Beirut
Attempts by Pro-DeGaulle forces to seize control of Lebanon would lead to intervention by pro-Vichy forces in Syria

Syrian annexation of Lebanon would have led to conflict with France, which regarded Lebanon as the key to its influence in the Near East and would see annexation by Syria as a direct challenge to its mandate authority
The fall of Teheran to Allied forces in 1941 led to an Allied 'protectorate' over Persia under the new Shah, 18 year-old Muhammad Reza Pahlavi, and military access.
The fall of Teheran to Allied forces in 1941 led to an Allied 'protectorate' over Persia under the new Shah, 18 year-old Muhammad Reza Pahlavi, and military access.
The installation of a pro-Allied government in Tehran would lead to Persia joining the Allied war effort.
The fall of Baghdad to British forces in 1941 led to the establishment of a pro-Allied regime in Iraq
The fall of Baghdad to British forces in 1941 led to the establishment of a pro-Allied regime in Iraq
The installation of a pro-Allied government in Baghdad would lead to Iraq joining the Allied war effort.
The fall of Baghdad to British forces in 1941 led to the establishment of a pro-Allied regime in Iraq
The nation has finally found a cause worth fighting for! Mobilize national forces to prove our country's greatness.
We must call up the reserves to defend our country.
The German government has offered us a non-aggression pact. This could increase security in the region.
The Bulgarian government has announced that it has no intention of entering into a non-aggression pact with us at the present time.
The Bulgarian government has announced that it will be happy to sign a non-aggression pact with us. This marks an era of new stability in the region.
We have the opportunity to sign a non-aggression pact with Bulgaria and thereby increase security for Thrace.
The New Roman Empire is born! Italy has reconstituted us, but we have lost territory and are their mere puppets.
The New Roman Empire is born! Italy has reconstituted us, but we have lost territory and are their mere puppets.

The French and Turkish governments concluded a mutual assistance treaty, based on the earlier Anglo-Turkish treaty. Under the Franco-Turkish pact, the French gave up all claims to the Republic of Hatay, which became a part of Turkey. In return, the Turkish government promised to extend mutual aid to France in the case of aggression. With the acquisition of Hatay, the Turkish government stood squarely behind the Western powers.

The British and Turkish governments announced a mutual aid agreement in the event of aggression or war, which marked the expansion of military assistance treaties in Eastern Europe to the Middle East. In spite of close economic ties with Germany, the Turkish government supported a British bloc to check German expansion into the Balkans.
The Greek and Turkish governments signed a Treaty of Friendship designed to promote security in the eastern Mediterranean.
The Italian government has approached us and offered to extend the Italian-Yemeni treaty. This could help us to remain independent from the British as well.

We have a unique chance to secure our northern border with Iraq by offering them a non-aggression agreement. This will please our own people as well as help in the development of a united Arab people.

The governments of Turkey, Iraq, Iran, and Afghanistan signed a non-aggression pact in Teheran. The Sa'adabad Pact was established to counter international tensions. This Islamic front offered the participating states an effective deterrent to the imperialistic designs of the European powers in the Middle East. The agreement secured the Asiatic region of Turkey as the Balkan Pact protected European Trace. Turkey was recognized as the crucial force for peace in Eastern Europe and its prestige bolstered this Asiatic pact.
In light of Franco-Syrian Treaty of 1936 which granted autonomy to several Syrian states, the Kurds in northeastern Syria mounted an insurrection, demanding autonomy and separate status.
The Yemeni government has decided that it is its best interest to ratify the non-aggression pact signed previously by the Saudi and Iraqi governments.

Premier Benito Mussolini conducted an official visit to the Italian colony of Libya where he declared his interest and friendship for Muslims around the world. He permitted the Arabs to hail him as the protector of Islam and accepted the sword of Islam. This announcement challenged Anglo-French dominance over the Arab states and they accused the Italians of passing subversive propaganda in North Africa, Egypt, Palestine, and Syria.
The Saudi Arabian and Egyptian governments signed a treaty whereby the Egyptians officially recognized the Saudi annexation of Hedjaz.
The Iraqi government has decided not to sign our proposed non-aggression agreement. This is indeed bad news for the Arab world.
The Iraqi government has decided to sign our proposed non-aggression agreement. This is indeed great news for the Arab world.

We have a unique chance to secure our northern border with Iraq by offering them a non-aggression agreement. This will please our own people as well as help in the development of a united Arab people.

The Saudi government has offered us a non-aggression agreement. The benefit is an obvious improvement of the security. The downside is that it may conflict with our own national interests in the future.
The fall of Teheran to Allied forces in 1941 led to an Allied 'protectorate' over Persia under the new Shah, 18 year-old Muhammad Reza Pahlavi, and military access.
The Persian refusal to grant the Allies military access led to a declaration of war on Persia by the Allies.
In August 1941, the British and Soviets demanded that Persia grant them military access so that supplies could be sent from the Allies to the Soviets.

One of the hardest-working members of the Shah's cabinet, Davar died under mysterious circumstances. Officially, the cause was stated as heart failure, which many leading members of Iranian society did not really believe. The truth later discovered was that he committed suicide by taking an opium overdose, rather than face royal anger over the steadily declining economic situation.
Soon after the failure of the Syrian rebellion against the French mandate, direct French authority was restored.
Soon after the failure of the Lebanese rebellion against the French mandate, direct French authority was restored.
The Armee du Levant was a French army in charge of maintaining French control over Lebanon. As such, it would refuse to be used as a tool by Lebanon to end French domination.
The Armee du Levant was a French army in charge of maintaining French control over Syria. As such, it would refuse to be used as a tool by Syria to end French domination.

With great sadness the government of Turkey announced that the founding father of the republic, Gazi Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, had passed on to the gates of paradise. Vice President Inonu took the oath of office as the second President of the Republic.

As the tide of war turned and the Soviets pushed the Germans westwards, Pan-Turkists sympathetic to the Germans demanded Turkey enter the war, claiming that Communist infiltration had kept Turkey out of the war. In May 1944, after a series of anti-communist demonstrations led to violence in Ankara and Istanbul, the Inonu regime decided to muzzle the Pan-Turkists once and for all in order to maintain internal stability and gain favor with the Allies and Soviets.

In 1942, in order to raise money for defense, Turkey passed the Varlik Vergisi, a levy on capital holdings of all citizens and residents living in Turkey. Since as much capital was controlled by non-Muslims and non-citizens, especially in Istanbul, the tax was seen by many as an attempt to Turkify the economy at the expense of minorities.

In light of the growing political unrest in our country, France has outlawed the Nationalist Party in an attempt to regain control of the growing separatist movement in the country. This action was not to the liking of the people of Syria and they have taken to the streets and declared a general strike in order to show their dislike of the French interference in Syrian politics. Our French masters have declared martial law in response to the recent developments.

With great sadness, the government of Iraq announced the death of King Ghazi I. He passed to the gates of paradise after his racing car crashed in the desert west of Baghdad. The 4 year old son of King Ghazi I, Faysal, ascended to the throne, and a regency headed by the new kingís uncle, Abd al-Ilah, handled the government until his Highness came of age.

In 1903, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany started the construction of a railway from Berlin to Baghdad. The end of the Great War, as well as the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, left the track unfinished. Discussions in 1936 decided to initiate the program again and finish the railway. Some cities that were affected by this included: Baghdad, Mosul, and Rawah. The railway was finished on 15th July 1940.

In 1903, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany started the construction of a railway from Berlin to Baghdad. The end of the Great War, as well as the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, left the track unfinished. Discussions in 1936 decided to initiate the program again and finish the railway. Some cities that were affected by this included: Baghdad, Mosul, and Rawah. Estimated completion was July 1940.

In 1903, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany started the construction of a railway from Berlin to Baghdad. The end of the Great War, as well as the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, left the track unfinished. Discussions in 1936 decided to initiate the program again and finish the railway. Some cities that were affected by this included: Baghdad, Mosul, and Rawah.
Having driven Vichy out of Syria, Britain returned control of Syria to Free France.
Having militarily driven Vichy out of Lebanon, Britain chose to return control of Lebanon to Free France.

To ensure Syria remained in the French sphere of influence, the 1936 Franco-Syrian treaty included a clause that would have France send troops for its protection in case Syria was attacked by a third party.

To ensure Lebanon remained in the French sphere of influence, the 1936 Franco-Lebanese treaty included a clause that would have France send troops for its protection in case Lebanon was attacked by a third party.
Bowing to British pressure and local riots, France granted Syria total independence.
Bowing to British pressure and local riots, France granted Lebanon total independence.
As the Second World war wound to a close in Europe, Lebanese nationalists began demanding complete independence from French colonialism.
As the Second World war wound to a close in Europe, Lebanese nationalists began demanding complete independence from French colonialism.
Bowing to British pressure, France granted Syria greater independence but retained rights of military access.
Bowing to British pressure, France granted Lebanon greater independence but retained rights of military access.
As the Allies pushed forward into Europe, Syrian nationalists demanded an end to direct French rule. They were supported in their demands by the British.
As the Allies pushed forward into Europe, Lebanese nationalists demanded an end to direct French rule. They were supported in their demands by the British.

After the fall of France to the Germans, and the corresponding emplacement of a more Fascist-aligned government, Vichy France moved quickly to reassert its claims on the French position in the Levant.
Vichy moved quickly to assert its claim to the French position in the Levant

To ensure Lebanon remained in the French sphere of influence, the 1936 Franco-Lebanese treaty included a clause that would have France send troops for its protection in case Lebanon was attacked by a third party. Lebanon was forced to install a new government.

To ensure Syria remained in the French sphere of influence, the 1936 Franco-Syrian treaty included a clause that would have France send troops for its protection in case Syria was attacked by a third party. Syria was forced to install a new government.

In 1937, neutral Iraq refused to allow British use of the Habaniyya Air Base, near Baghdad, in spite of the 1930 Treaty. The British decided to force the issue by demanding a pro-British government in Iraq.
To ensure Iraq remained in the British sphere, the 1936 Anglo-Iraq treaty included a clause that would have Britain send troops in the case that Iraq was attacked by a third party.

The Fascist factions eventually demanded that all Turkish people be united under the same flag. Pan-Turkists sympathetic to the Germans demanded Turkish entry into the war, claiming that Communist infiltration had kept Turkey out of the war. A series of anti-Communist demonstrations led to violence in Ankara and Istanbul.

The peaceful, or rather bloodless, acquisition of Czechoslovakia was a boon to German war industry and technology. The Czechs were definite leaders in effective medium tanks, and their 38(t) tank was considered one of the best in the world and had a main gun that was more effective than anything mounted on German tanks at the time. Even during the French campaign, the 38(t) tank gun was second only in effectiveness to the famed 88. The occupation of Czechoslovakia in effect gave the Wehrmacht hundreds of these types of machines, and the industry and technology to support them.

Bulgaria had been looking for resolution of her territorial claims for years. In one sweeping move, the Axis seemed likely to grant the Dobruja to Bulgaria. Naturally, this pleased the Bulgarian government immensely.

As the German political position improved in Europe, Germany moved to sort things out in the Balkans as best she could. Why Germany took this course was a matter of some speculation at the time. Perhaps a move against the Middle East? Perhaps securing her southern flank for a move East? Nevertheless, as part of this arrangement, Romania was forced to cede territories not only to Hungary, but also the Dobruja to Bulgaria. In return, Germany provided a guarantee of the reduced Romanian territory.

The America First Committee was a large scale expression of isolationism in America. Many Americans felt that the U.S. had gained nothing by her involvement in World War One, and saw the conflict between Germany and the Allied powers as simply another European imbroglio that didn't involve the interests of the United States. On 1st September 1940, Charles Lindbergh and others formed the America First Committee which held mass meetings and put enormous political pressure on FDR's government to stay out of the war. At its height, the America First Committee had 800,000 members from all walks of life. Until the attack on Pearl Harbor, many Americans tended to agree with the Committee that Axis expansion simply didn't pose a direct threat to the US - a view which also came from traditional ideas of America's invulnerability to foreign attack.

The French political scene was deeply divided prior to World War Two, as a result of domestic disputes that extended deep into French culture, and which had been originally exposed during the turmoil surrounding the Dreyfuss affair prior to World War One. As a result, the French were not terribly unified in the face of the rising power and threat of Germany.
Germany's staunch refusal to cede Polish lands put the Poles at a political and military crossroads
Poland's ultra-aggressive stance in regards to territorial claims on Germany left Hitler's Wehrmacht in a dangerous position as it battled with France on the Western Front.
Poland's aggressive stance in regards to territorial claims on Germany left Hitler's Wehrmacht in a dangerous position as it battled with France on the Western Front.

Germany's second war of the century with France left Germany's eastern flank exposed to Poland.  Poland saw the opportunity to secure her territorial claims in Prussia and Germany.  Or would she seek more?

Prior to actually attacking Belgium, Holland, and Luxembourg on 10th May 1940, Germany repeatedly promised never to violate Belgian or Dutch neutrality. Whether a ruse or a later change of policy by Germany, Belgium and the Netherlands went out of their way to believe the Germans. In fact most of Europe could not believe that Germany would violate Belgian neutrality for the second time in 25 years, especially after promising to respect it on each occasion.
After the fall of Holland, the KNIL (Koninklijk Nederlands-Indische Leger) increased the numbers of colonial troops.
War has broken out in Europe, we are mobilizing our nation.
War has broken out in Europe, we are mobilizing our nation.

American aviator Amelia Earhart has arrived at Bandoeng on the island of Java in her quest to circumnavigate the globe. She arrived from Singapore and will be departing for Darwin, Australia via Timor in three days. The short delay is so technicians from KLM East Indies Airline can perform some much needed maintenance on her navigation gear and engines. From Darwin, she will head to Honolulu, and then on to Oakland, California.
Surrounded and with resistance crumbling, the Government in the East Indies is asked to surrender to the Japanese.
The U.S. government dispatched American troops to occupy Dutch Guiana to protect the colonies' resources and prevent Axis agents from using the territory for operations.

The trade provisions of the Oslo Agreement between Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, Denmark, Norway, and Sweden, which had promoted trade between these European states, were terminated. Political concerns held precedence over economic issues. Despite the termination of the trade agreements, relations between the Oslo powers remained close.

Delegates of the Low Countries and Scandinavia have met in The Hague to sign a new trade agreement to promote economic relations between the signatory states, greatly improving conditions for their national industries.
The Belgian government extended the term of service for infantry troops from seven months to 18 months in a plan to expand the size of the Belgian army.
To deal with the excesses of the Rexists, the Belgian government has proclaimed martial law and clamped down on the fascists. Leon Degrelle, a leader for the Rexists was arrested in the crackdown.

We have asked United Kingdom for reassurance that they will intervene on our behalf of us in case of a future war with Germany. In light of the recent German occupation of the Rhineland this threat has moved closer. The British have failed to reply to our request.

We have asked United Kingdom for reassurance that they will intervene on our behalf of us in case of a future war with Germany. In light of the recent German occupation of the Rhineland this threat has moved closer. England as reassured us that they will respond immediately should any such actions become necessary.

The Nobel Foundation has named the laureate for the 1938 Nobel Prize in Medicine. This year's laureate is Corneille Jean Francois Heymans (Belgium), for the discovery of the role played by the sinus and aortic mechanisms in the regulation of respiration.

The Nobel Foundation has named the laureate for the 1936 Nobel Prize in Chemistry. This year's laureate is Petrus Josephus Wilhelmus Debye (Netherlands), for his contributions to our knowledge of molecular structure through his investigations on dipole moments and on the diffraction of X-rays and electrons in gases.
On 17th October 1937, workers doing dangerous work had their work-weeks shortened to 40 hours.

On 30th September 1938, the Luxembourg Army expanded and gained 300 more volunteers at the decree of the Grand Duchess. They would be later organized into 6 officers, 2 adjutants, 2 Sergeants Major, 12 Sergeants, 24 Corporals, 57 Privates First Class and 200 Privates.
In 1937, the innovative Radio Luxembourg began broadcasting new programs, including two popular quiz shows.
After the defeat of France and Britain, the puppet governments could not deny Germany the return of her former colonies. The Belgian Congo was handed over to Germany.
On 30th January 1939, Hitler demanded the return of all former German colonies. Belgium had administered a small part of German East Africa, the province Kigali.

In 1936, Germany violated stipulations of the treaty of Versailles set down at the end of the First World War. The Treaty stated that no German military forces were allowed on the western side of the Rhine. When Hitler had troops march ostentatiously into this area, many nations were shocked. Some, such as France, Belgium, and the Netherlands, were forced to decide on a new policy to deal with this aggressive behavior. Belgium had to decide whether to align with the German movement, or to remain with its traditional allies.

In 1936, Germany violated stipulations of the treaty of Versailles set down at the end of the First World War. The Treaty stated that no German military forces were allowed on the western side of the Rhine. When Hitler had troops march ostentatiously into this area, many nations were shocked. Some, such as France, Belgium, and the Netherlands, were forced to decide on a new policy to deal with this aggressive behavior. The Netherlands decided to secure its border with Germany.

In 1936, Germany violated stipulations of the treaty of Versailles set down at the end of the First World War. The Treaty stated that no German military forces were allowed on the western side of the Rhine. When Hitler had troops march ostentatiously into this area, many nations were shocked. Some, such as France, Belgium, and the Netherlands, were forced to decide on a new policy to deal with this aggressive behavior.
